messages.subject: Anti-war movie
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/30/02 11:21:34 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/30/02 11:21:34 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Dear Unschoolers: We saw an incredible anti war movie that is
appropriate for kids. It is called "The Grave of the Fireflies" about
two orphans in Japan in WWII. It is Japanese animation which is amazing
in itself. If you have the chance rent it. It is worth it. Lisa of MT >>

I second the opinion here! Taht is an EXCELLENT movie, but not for all
children as it is very, very heart wrenching. It's a top rated Japanese
anime, but it will upset sensitive people too much as it is brutally honest
about the atrocities of war.
Not graphic necessarily, but SO sad.

Ren

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Anti-war movie
messages.msgSnippet: I had just seen an ad for this movie in a magazine & was wondering about it,hopefully I can buy it.I think they are selling it at best buy if anybody wanted to
messages.messageBody:
I had just seen an ad for this movie in a magazine & was wondering about it,hopefully I can buy it.I think they are selling it at best buy if anybody wanted to buy it.Thanks for posting about it.We love japanese animation.
Renee
Lisa Hardiman <lisa-hardiman@...> wrote:Dear Unschoolers: We saw an incredible anti war movie that is
appropriate for kids. It is called "The Grave of the Fireflies" about
two orphans in Japan in WWII. It is Japanese animation which is amazing
in itself. If you have the chance rent it. It is worth it. Lisa of MT

messages.subject: Anti-war movie
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Unschoolers:  We saw an incredible anti war movie that is appropriate for kids.  It is called The Grave of the Fireflies  about two orphans in Japan in
messages.messageBody:
Dear Unschoolers: We saw an incredible anti war movie that is
appropriate for kids. It is called "The Grave of the Fireflies" about
two orphans in Japan in WWII. It is Japanese animation which is amazing
in itself. If you have the chance rent it. It is worth it. Lisa of MT


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
